timeline.message:
Add JanusGraphServer and JanusGraphSettings

Partial fixes #2119

* Add custom JanusGraph header on startup
* Print JanusGraph version on startup
* Auto configure serializers for gremlin

Signed-off-by: Jan Jansen <jan.jansen@gdata.de>

timeline.bodyText:
Replace [...] - This formulation sounds like I have to do the replacement now as the user. Shouldn't this be
Introduction of a JanusGraph Server startup class as a replacement for Gremlin Server startup
or
Replacing the Gremlin Server startup class with JanusGraph specific variant
?
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -131,6 +131,18 @@ Therefore, you should upgrade to Cassandra 3 or higher.
     or never changed the value of `storage.cql.storage-compact=true`, during the 
     upgrade process you have to ensure your data is correctly migrated.
 
+##### Replace the Gremlin Server startup class with JanusGraph variant

timeline.bodyText: Similarly to my comment above, this doesn't explain that a new JanusGraph specific startup is introduced in this release. I would start with one sentence to explain this fact and afterwards explain the reasoning for it (which is currently the only thing explained here) and then tell the user how they are impacted by this change / which changes they have to make when updating.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -131,6 +131,18 @@ Therefore, you should upgrade to Cassandra 3 or higher.
     or never changed the value of `storage.cql.storage-compact=true`, during the 
     upgrade process you have to ensure your data is correctly migrated.
 
+##### Replace the Gremlin Server startup class with JanusGraph variant
+
+`JanusGraphServer` class allows us to add JanusGraph specfic settings to the

timeline.bodyText: revert, wouldn't prevent be more accurate?
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -131,6 +131,18 @@ Therefore, you should upgrade to Cassandra 3 or higher.
     or never changed the value of `storage.cql.storage-compact=true`, during the 
     upgrade process you have to ensure your data is correctly migrated.
 
+##### Replace the Gremlin Server startup class with JanusGraph variant
+
+`JanusGraphServer` class allows us to add JanusGraph specfic settings to the 
+`gremlin-server.yaml` or `janusgraph-server.yaml`. Further, JanusGraph will ensure 
+serializers are configured as expected for running JanusGraph and interact with Gremlin. 
+JanusGraph will also print the JanusGraph version and Tinkerpop version at the start 
+of the `JanusGraphServer`.
+
+!!! note
+    You are able the revert the default configuration of serializers by setting

timeline.bodyText: (nitpick) unused import
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann
timeline.diffHunk:

+
+import com.jcabi.manifests.Manifests;
+import org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.server.GremlinServer;
+import org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.server.Settings;

timeline.bodyText: Was this a TODO or what is its purpose?
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText:
The read(final String file) is just an overload of read(final InputStream stream) but it has a different behaviour as it also performs autoImport (if preventAutoConfiguration is not set)
I think that's confusing and would prefer if both overloads would have the same behavior except for the fact that one takes a String while the other takes a Stream. So read(final InputStream stream) should already call autoImport in my opinion.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: from a file This method isn't taking a file but a Stream.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't Optional be JanusGraphSettings?
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: (nitpick) How about moving this copying from one settings to another into a dedicated method for that to not clutter this method?
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: janusgraph-server.yaml was only added in this PR and it's now the default config file for JanusGraph Server (if I'm not mistaken). This should be explained here. Otherwise users will just think that their gremlin-server.yaml is still being used and wonder why their changes to that config don't have any effect.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

+`gremlin-server.yaml` or `janusgraph-server.yaml`. Further, JanusGraph will ensure

timeline.bodyText: Is there really no other way to use an existing config file and something to it than to copy every element explicitly? This means that we have to change this every time something changes in the GremlinServer settings :/
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: TinkerPop
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

+JanusGraph will also print the JanusGraph version and Tinkerpop version at the start

timeline.bodyText: I think it would be good state here explicitly which elements are now configured automatically by default to make it easier for users to update their config. The new default config could also be linked as an additional help.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -131,6 +131,18 @@ Therefore, you should upgrade to Cassandra 3 or higher.

+##### Replace the Gremlin Server startup class with JanusGraph variant

+`gremlin-server.yaml` or `janusgraph-server.yaml`. Further, JanusGraph will ensure 
+serializers are configured as expected for running JanusGraph and interact with Gremlin.

timeline.bodyText: We already discussed this directly, but just to keep it also here on record: I think that it's a bit confusing that some serializers are configured by default, but these two are still configured here explicitly. So, I would also configure them by default.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,38 @@
+# Copyright 2020 JanusGraph Authors

+# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");

+host: 0.0.0.0
+channelizer: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.server.channel.WebSocketChannelizer
+graphs: {
+    graph: conf/janusgraph-inmemory.properties
+}
+scriptEngines: {
+    gremlin-groovy: {
+        plugins: { org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.server.jsr223.GremlinServerGremlinPlugin: {},
+                   org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.tinkergraph.jsr223.TinkerGraphGremlinPlugin: {},
+                   org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.jsr223.ImportGremlinPlugin: {classImports: [java.lang.Math], methodImports: [java.lang.Math#*]},
+                   org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.jsr223.ScriptFileGremlinPlugin: {files: [scripts/empty-sample.groovy]}}}}
+serializers:
+    - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GraphBinaryMessageSerializerV1, config: { serializeResultToString: true }}

(nitpick) I think -no-auto and -cfg aren't descriptive enough to explain the purpose of these config files. Could you make the names a bit more descriptive?

timeline.message:
Add JanusGraphServer and Default serializers

Partial fixes #2119

* Add custom JanusGraph header on startup
* Print JanusGraph version on startup
* Default set of TinkerPop serializers

Signed-off-by: Jan Jansen <jan.jansen@gdata.de>

Some review comment resolvings

Signed-off-by: Jan Jansen <jan.jansen@gdata.de>

timeline.bodyText: (nitpick) It isn't really part of this PR, but shouldn't this also include GraphBinary?
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

timeline.bodyText: The content of this script should be the next element here.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -473,32 +473,37 @@ scriptEngines: {
                org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.tinkergraph.jsr223.TinkerGraphGremlinPlugin: {},
                org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.jsr223.ImportGremlinPlugin: {classImports: [java.lang.Math], methodImports: [java.lang.Math#*]},
                org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.jsr223.ScriptFileGremlinPlugin: {files: [scripts/empty-sample.groovy]}}}}
-serializers:
-  - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GryoMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { ioRegistries: [org.janusgraph.graphdb.tinkerpop.JanusGraphIoRegistry] }}
-  - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GryoMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { serializeResultToString: true }}
-  - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GraphSONMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { ioRegistries: [org.janusgraph.graphdb.tinkerpop.JanusGraphIoRegistry] }}
+# JanusGraph sets default serializers. You need to uncomment the following lines, if you require any custom serializers.
+#
+# serializers:
+#   - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GryoMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { ioRegistries: [org.janusgraph.graphdb.tinkerpop.JanusGraphIoRegistry] }}
+#   - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GryoMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { serializeResultToString: true }}
+#   - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GraphSONMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { ioRegistries: [org.janusgraph.graphdb.tinkerpop.JanusGraphIoRegistry] }}
 metrics: {
   slf4jReporter: {enabled: true, interval: 180000}}
 ```
 
 **There are several important parts to this configuration file as they relate to JanusGraph.**
 
-1.  In the `graphs` map, there is a key called `graph` and its value is
-    `conf/janusgraph.properties`. This tells Gremlin Server to
-    instantiate a `Graph` instance called "graph" and use the
-    `conf/janusgraph.properties` file to configure it. The "graph" key
-    becomes the unique name for the `Graph` instance in Gremlin Server
-    and it can be referenced as such in the scripts submitted to it.
-
-2.  In the `plugins` list, there is a reference to
-    `JanusGraphGremlinPlugin`, which tells Gremlin Server to initialize
-    the "JanusGraph Plugin". The "JanusGraph Plugin" will auto-import
-    JanusGraph specific classes for usage in scripts.
-
-3.  Note the `scripts` key and the reference to
-    `scripts/janusgraph.groovy`. This Groovy file is an initialization
-    script for Gremlin Server and that particular ScriptEngine. Create
-    `scripts/janusgraph.groovy` with the following contents:
+1. In the `graphs` map, there is a key called `graph` and its value is
+   `conf/janusgraph.properties`. This tells Gremlin Server to
+   instantiate a `Graph` instance called "graph" and use the
+   `conf/janusgraph.properties` file to configure it. The "graph" key
+   becomes the unique name for the `Graph` instance in Gremlin Server
+   and it can be referenced as such in the scripts submitted to it.
+
+2. In the `plugins` list, there is a reference to
+   `JanusGraphGremlinPlugin`, which tells Gremlin Server to initialize
+   the "JanusGraph Plugin". The "JanusGraph Plugin" will auto-import
+   JanusGraph specific classes for usage in scripts.
+
+3. Note the `scripts` key and the reference to
+   `scripts/janusgraph.groovy`. This Groovy file is an initialization
+   script for Gremlin Server and that particular ScriptEngine. Create
+   `scripts/janusgraph.groovy` with the following contents:

timeline.bodyText: by an default set of serializers -> with a default set of serializers
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -473,32 +473,37 @@ scriptEngines: {
                org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.tinkergraph.jsr223.TinkerGraphGremlinPlugin: {},

                org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.jsr223.ScriptFileGremlinPlugin: {files: [scripts/empty-sample.groovy]}}}}
-serializers:
-  - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GryoMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { ioRegistries: [org.janusgraph.graphdb.tinkerpop.JanusGraphIoRegistry] }}
-  - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GryoMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { serializeResultToString: true }}
-  - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GraphSONMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { ioRegistries: [org.janusgraph.graphdb.tinkerpop.JanusGraphIoRegistry] }}

+#
+# serializers:
+#   - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GryoMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { ioRegistries: [org.janusgraph.graphdb.tinkerpop.JanusGraphIoRegistry] }}
+#   - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GryoMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { serializeResultToString: true }}
+#   - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GraphSONMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { ioRegistries: [org.janusgraph.graphdb.tinkerpop.JanusGraphIoRegistry] }}
 metrics: {
   slf4jReporter: {enabled: true, interval: 180000}}
 ```
 
 **There are several important parts to this configuration file as they relate to JanusGraph.**
 
-1.  In the `graphs` map, there is a key called `graph` and its value is
-    `conf/janusgraph.properties`. This tells Gremlin Server to
-    instantiate a `Graph` instance called "graph" and use the
-    `conf/janusgraph.properties` file to configure it. The "graph" key
-    becomes the unique name for the `Graph` instance in Gremlin Server
-    and it can be referenced as such in the scripts submitted to it.
-
-2.  In the `plugins` list, there is a reference to
-    `JanusGraphGremlinPlugin`, which tells Gremlin Server to initialize
-    the "JanusGraph Plugin". The "JanusGraph Plugin" will auto-import
-    JanusGraph specific classes for usage in scripts.
-
-3.  Note the `scripts` key and the reference to
-    `scripts/janusgraph.groovy`. This Groovy file is an initialization
-    script for Gremlin Server and that particular ScriptEngine. Create
-    `scripts/janusgraph.groovy` with the following contents:
+1. In the `graphs` map, there is a key called `graph` and its value is
+   `conf/janusgraph.properties`. This tells Gremlin Server to
+   instantiate a `Graph` instance called "graph" and use the
+   `conf/janusgraph.properties` file to configure it. The "graph" key
+   becomes the unique name for the `Graph` instance in Gremlin Server
+   and it can be referenced as such in the scripts submitted to it.
+
+2. In the `plugins` list, there is a reference to
+   `JanusGraphGremlinPlugin`, which tells Gremlin Server to initialize
+   the "JanusGraph Plugin". The "JanusGraph Plugin" will auto-import
+   JanusGraph specific classes for usage in scripts.
+
+3. Note the `scripts` key and the reference to
+   `scripts/janusgraph.groovy`. This Groovy file is an initialization
+   script for Gremlin Server and that particular ScriptEngine. Create
+   `scripts/janusgraph.groovy` with the following contents:
+
+4. Note the `serializers` list will be configured by an default set of serializers,

timeline.bodyText:
How can that happen if the user uses the default bin/gremlin-server.sh script from the Gremlin Server distributed by Apache TinkerPop as described here?
I think this section needs to mention our custom startup class and that it can be used by adapting the script which will then result in the automatic configuration of serializers. (In that case, the example output from starting the server also needs to be changed to include the JanusGraph ascii art.)
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -473,32 +473,37 @@ scriptEngines: {
                org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.tinkergraph.jsr223.TinkerGraphGremlinPlugin: {},

                org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.jsr223.ScriptFileGremlinPlugin: {files: [scripts/empty-sample.groovy]}}}}
-serializers:
-  - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GryoMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { ioRegistries: [org.janusgraph.graphdb.tinkerpop.JanusGraphIoRegistry] }}
-  - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GryoMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { serializeResultToString: true }}
-  - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GraphSONMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { ioRegistries: [org.janusgraph.graphdb.tinkerpop.JanusGraphIoRegistry] }}

+#
+# serializers:
+#   - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GryoMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { ioRegistries: [org.janusgraph.graphdb.tinkerpop.JanusGraphIoRegistry] }}
+#   - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GryoMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { serializeResultToString: true }}
+#   - { className: org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.driver.ser.GraphSONMessageSerializerV3d0, config: { ioRegistries: [org.janusgraph.graphdb.tinkerpop.JanusGraphIoRegistry] }}

   slf4jReporter: {enabled: true, interval: 180000}}
 ```

-1.  In the `graphs` map, there is a key called `graph` and its value is

-    instantiate a `Graph` instance called "graph" and use the

+   instantiate a `Graph` instance called "graph" and use the

timeline.message:
Add JanusGraphServer and Default serializers

Partial fixes #2119

* Add custom JanusGraph header on startup
* Print JanusGraph version on startup
* Default set of TinkerPop serializers

Signed-off-by: Jan Jansen <jan.jansen@gdata.de>

Add JanusGraphServer and Default serializers

Partial fixes #2119

* Add custom JanusGraph header on startup
* Print JanusGraph version on startup
* Default set of TinkerPop serializers

Signed-off-by: Jan Jansen <jan.jansen@gdata.de>
